answers.answer: aww hunny im so sry you had to go through all that. I hope you are ok now! congrats on ur new bundle of joy :)
Congrats!! Sorry it was a rough experience.

Aw! I'm so happy for you. I've had all of the symptoms of preeclampsia and because my high blood pressure and protein don't seem to happen together at the EXACT moment they test me, they won't induce me. My feet turn purple from swelling and they are sending me to be monitored every other day and appointments twice a week. It's crazy how I'm 37 and 3 days but they are keeping me pregnant and absolutely miserable for no reason. I'm so tired and in pain :(

Alexia - they wouldn't have induced me either but since my water broke they were forced to. Just don't leave that hospital with severe swelling! I weighed more after I had them than before. & I had so much swelling it had no where to go but my lungs. When I got to the bigger hospital they got 25 lbs of fluid off of me & I immediately started getting better.
Now that scares me I have toxemia so I'm getting shots to help the baby then they are taking her, I keep hearing stories about the moms after birth
That's scary but glad everything is ok now. And congrats on baby boy.
Your a very strong women for having to go through all that. I'm glad you and baby are doing well. Congratulations on your healthy baby boy!!
That's quite the roller coaster but congratulations mommy!! :)
You poor thing ;( but I'm sure you're glowing with your precious baby in your arms! I hope mine doesn't get as bad, I guess we will just have to watch it close! Don't forget to post pictures! : )

question: My baby boy was due today, but my water broke around 5am on 9-24. My husband had ready left forward work, but my sister was with me and took me to the hospital. I had been having symptoms of pre-eclampsia, and sure enough when I got to the hospital there was protein in my urine. They started me on pitocin and some meds to keep me from having seizures due to the pre-eclampsia. I got the epidural and it didn't work!!! Finally after 24 hours of labor I started to push. Little man's shoulder got stuck coming out so I didn't even get to see him until 5 hours later after they weaned him off oxygen. He took to breastfeeding right away though. I had a 4th degree tear. On Friday I was dischared, but a few hours after being home my hubby rushed me to the ER because I couldn't breathe. I ended up being flown by helicopter to another hospital where they had to get fluid off my lungs and treat the eclampsia. Long story short, everything that could have went wrong did, and it was a terrifying experience, but I have a beautiful, 7lbs 11 oz baby boy who I would do it all over for again in a heartbeat. I hope you all have much smoother labors,  and good luck to toy ladies!
title: My long labor story
